name: Holiday Inn Express - Kamloops

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights this summer with the family.
reviews.title: Average and average price

reviews.text: Booking by telephone was easy and friendly, but checking-in was slow, with one receptionist and a queue of families and luggage into the front doorway. To give the receptionist fair dues, she was patient, smiley and friendly to all.
reviews.title: kind of OK

reviews.text: The room was a reasonable size, two double beds, a fridge, small table and 2 chairs, but the decor was dated, the tv old-fashioned (we weren't able to use our own DVD player!), noisy air-conditioning and no kettle or microwave. Wi-FI internet was ok. We didn't try the pool. The room was well cleaned and tidied up by the cleaning staff. Parking was no problem (and no extra charge).
reviews.title: Good choice if just passing through

reviews.text: Breakfast was good.. pancakes, muffins, bagels and eggs, yoghurt and cereal.... enough to satisfy the small family. We did not try the on-site Tandoori Restaurant.
reviews.title: Never stay again!

reviews.text: We would probably chose one of the other Kamloops hotels first (due to room size, bed size & decor), but this is perfectly adequate.
reviews.title: Excellent service at this chain hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night on our way home from Alberta. The hotel is nice and clean. The beds were comfortable and the continental breakfast was good. The location is great for travellers but there is not much in the way of restaurants within walking distance. In the immediate area you have Dairy Queen, Triple O's, and McDonalds.
reviews.title: Great beds and location to hwy but noisy.

reviews.text: The only negative about the hotel was the paper thin doors. You could hear everything that was happening in the corridor. When I say that you can hear everything I mean you can hear every word of any conversation going on in detail not just noise. We were unfortunate enough to have a group of 19-22 year olds drinking outside their rooms from 10:30pm - 11:30pm.
reviews.title: Okay place for an overnight stay

reviews.text: The Hilton/Hampton chain has become our first choice of hotels as their customer service is unequalled by anyone. The Hampton was completely booked when we arrived so we stayed at the H.I.E. instead, no complaints, clean, polite staff, good breakfast. They have the neatest little pancake maker!
reviews.title: Average hotel, loved the little pancake machine

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way home from Seattle with my husband and father-in-law. We always get hooped when I don't book ahead and we arrived to find Kamloops full up with a baseball tournament. Luckily we took the last two rooms in the hotel. The rooms were average, but clean with comfortable king sized bed. The breakfast buffet would have been better except we came down at the same time an entire little girl baseball team did. The food was all quickly scooped up and we had to cram into a corner and wait for food. This in no way was any fault of the hotel... how could you time that? The attendants tried their best and I did love the little pancake maching that made as many fresh hot pancakes and you wanted. Grandpa was a little overwhelmed with the comotion and I wish we would have taken him out to a restauruant. We stopped at the East Side Mario's across the highway for dinner and it was pretty predictable. Overall a good stop over hotel if your passing through.
reviews.title: GM gives great customer service and we'll be back!

reviews.text: This was the first out-of-province road trip for our family of four. One mishap after another occured, including a sick son (later diagnosed as strep throat) with car sickness, and we were booked to stay at the Holiday Inn Express Kamloops. There was an accident which caused the highway to be closed so we couldn't get to Kamloops. There was no cell phone service on the highway so we were considered a no-show by the hotel. It wasn't until five days later enroute home that we thought we'd stop by the hotel and let them know of our situation and see if we could get credited for the no-show. The front desk person was very sympathetic but I got a lecture from the sales manager for not calling as soon as I could (with a sick son, it was the last thing on our minds) and said it would be up to the GM who wasn't in. And wouldn't you know it, this is when the van's "Check Engine" light came on, which caused another delay, but that's another story! Once we got home, I contacted the GM who said she would check into this and let me know. We got a call back to tell us we would be credited with the no-show!!! You can be sure that this great customer service will propel me to give back ten-fold by sharing my experience and returning to HI Express the next time we travel to the coast!
reviews.title: Not too bad for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the parking lot lights were out. I asked the front desk about it and was given a blank look and an "ohh". Our vehicle has been ripped before in a similar ituation and are a little gunshy about security. But we had pre-paid for the room so we had to stay.
reviews.title: Good Enough But

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is poorly lit with a good bed. The bathroom was well lit but the counter space is quite limited. The wall-to-wall carpet is poorly fitted with small bare spaces along one wall.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, we enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was standard for the HIE. Not bad, Wi-Fi was slow compared to other HIE locations.
reviews.title: Best chain breakfast bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drink machines were out of stock. I had to go to three different floors to get what I wanted.
reviews.title: Far exceeded expectations

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed in a jacuzzi suite at the Holiday Inn Express in Kamloops on our way from Vancouver to Calgary in November of 2010. The service was good - I was immediately recognized as a priority club member, given a welcome letter and offered a late check-out. We enjoyed our stay and had a good night sleep.
reviews.title: Worst stay at a Holiday Inn Express ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a one night stop over and were very pleased with the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great service, superb sleep!

reviews.text: We were greeted by professional and friendly staff who offered a envelope with a welcome letter and chocolates because we were Priority Club members. The room was freshly renovated, clean, and the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Not a Hockey Team friendly environment, staff is too RUDE.

reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning was tasty and the room was very well attended to by 2 hostesses who kept everything stocked up and tables cleared.
reviews.title: Don't seem to follow typical HI Express chain protocol, unfortunately.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a great stay and a very convenient location - close to Aberdeen Mall and Costco, and right off Hwy 1. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Hotel doesn't even provide complimentary water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family was part of a three team group (approx. 150 people in total) staying at this establishment March 31 - April 3, 2011 for the AAA Kamloops Pirate Challenge Tourney for children ages 8 -11. We were treated with what can only be described as total disrespect. When you stop to to consider the amount of money that this hotel was making from our very large group you would hope that they would have the courtesy to at least speak to us in a professional manner. Instead, our group was harassed by the night staff, told that we had to "end our social time at 9:30 because you signed a contract!" and "Go to bed!". The tone of voice that was used by this H.I.E. staffer was unacceptable. A simple "would you please wrap it up for the evening" would have done the trick. Sadly the evening staff chose to go the route of negativity which left a bad taste in the mouths of a lot of paying patrons. I can say with total confidence that this is not a place I would chose to stay again with my young family. A simple SMILE is an elusive thing at the Holiday Inn Express on Versatile Drive in Kamloops.
reviews.title: HIE, Kamloops

description: Our British Columbia Lodging Welcomes You The Holiday Inn Express Hotel Kamloops is furnished with our guests in mind. We invite you to experience our personalized service in stylish comfort. Whether you are traveling for business or during a British Columbia vacation, our award-winning Kamloops hotel's mission is to provide our guests with an unforgettable stay. Given Kamloop's location at the juncture of a few major highways, the town has become a business hot spot in the British Columbia Interior. Our Kamloop hotel's location provides business travelers with quick and easy access to downtown. The Holiday Inn Express Kamloops hotel is the perfect stop-off between the Rocky Mountains and Vancouver. The region offers a rich variety of geographical terrain, with mountains, lakes, rivers, and forests. Leisure guests will find no end to outdoor adventures near this British Columbia lodging. In addition, guests enjoy close proximity to the BC Wildlife Park, Sun Peaks Ski Resort, Stake Lake, Interior Savings Center, Aberdeen Mall and Thompson Rivers University. A star among Kamloops hotels, this affordable accommodation includes 100% non-smoking rooms, an indoor pool, Jacuzzi, modern Fitness Centre, free high-speed Internet access, spacious business-class rooms and a free Express Start Breakfast served every morning.
